We did check the setting on control keys the print is marked there. In OPK8 settings are also correct. We can't find why it is skipping some order every time. But when we check the order that is missing in spool we see it has PRT status and in history we see log it was printed at the same time as other orders.

Do you know why it may be happening?

entry.title: Re: How to Prevent Shipping Costs from Being Distributed...
entry.content:
Good day @Husi 

Thank you for your question.

Please review these references for more details:

KBA 3618341, Distribution Between Header and Items, Header Level, Header and Item Conditions

So, the answer to your question is no, not in cloud when you use standard pricing. You have the option to either proportionally distribute the cost or have the same amount copied to each item. What you are currently experiencing is a public cloud restriction. Freight surcharge at the header as you mentioned are only a convenience UI. Considering your total freight is distributed proportionally to the items, that indicates your condition type is marked as Group Condition. If it is not marked as Group Condition, then the same freight amount will be copied to each item, which you also don‚Äôt want.

To summarise, depending on your business case, if you want to see freight only once in the document, you should consider:

  • Keeping your current distribution but adjust forms to show only the header total, or
  • Replacing the header freight condition with a separate freight item in your sales order, which then appears once and posts to a freight revenue account you dedicate, or
  • Making use of TM-based charge management, where your freight is managed and posted separately.

So, from the public clouds clean-core perspective, the simplest way for you to ensure freight appears only once without relying on the header distribution is to model your freight as a dedicated sales order item.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Internal error in FORM/FUNCTION ckms_buffer_write in...
entry.content:
In OMSY just make check box on ABp, Make sure you have maintain posting period variant in transaction OBY6 for your company code. 
Standered Posting Period variant is 0001. 
If 0001 is not there you can check for existing one  through transaction code OB52. Take any existing one which is correctly configured and enter in OBY6 for your company code.

Regards,
Lalit J

entry.title: Carrer Restart
entry.content:
Hi friends,

I was a former SAP consultant working in the IS-Retail and SD domain with an experience of 4.5 years . I was passionate about the EV transition and attended an event three years ago, which actually rekindled my excitement again. So, I left my job and started my own startup. However, as this market is mainly dominated by China, there is hardly any scope left for India. I built a SaaS product, raised funds, and got some customers, but unfortunately, the startup failed. I'm not getting hired in the EV domain because of the lack of relevant skills, and I'm barely left with any personal runway for survival. I'm in real trouble and don't know what to do with my career. Should I stay in the Emobility domain or come back to SAP consulting by learning some courses? Please guide me, as I'm at a difficult stage in my career where every day matters for me.

Thanks

RISE with SAP SAP S/4HANA SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics

entry.title: Re: Staging Job not working - All staging proposal quanti...
entry.content:
Hello @Chris1973,

thanks for you comment. I read the SAP help articels but it seems to be set up correctly.

"First, can you check if your BOM component staging indicator is set to 2 (which releases Order Part) or 3 (which creates Part)? If not, that might explain why your proposal quantity delivers 0."

This is a screenshot of the exact PSA, the Production Order is using. The staging indicator is set to 3 and it is supposed to calculcate the quantities bases on the PMR. I did not fill out any other quantities in that line.

Your second check "make sure you confirm that the component is linked to a Supply Area in the routing. If it is not, then your demand cannot be calculated." can also be seen in that screenshot as I don't have a product specified, so it should work for all the components in the Production order.

"Third, please check if your work center, supply area, EWM staging area is mapped end-to-end. If your staging bin cannot be determined, then your proposal will equal 0" - checked it - should be fine. And the configuration should be working as the PMR looks correct.

"Fourth, your PMR needs to be ready for staging because only then does the automatic job pick it. Your status seems set to ‚ÄúNot begun‚Äù or ‚ÄúReleased‚Äù, if I understood that correctly, then your proposal will be 0 because staging is not ready."

The PMR status for completion is "not started" - but isn't that correct? I haven't started the picking yet. The sttaus of the prudction order is "Released" as I can see in the PMR itself. Otherwise the PMR wouldn't have been created either.

Kind regards

Jan

entry.title: Re: Fiori Elements Value Help token shows GUID instead of...
entry.content:
@ncrim7 

You need to add this annotation to your ProductManagerEntities:

annotate service.ProductManagerEntities with {
    @Common.Text: fullName
    @Common.TextArrangement: #TextOnly
    ID
};

The @Common.Text annotation on the ID field of the ValueList entity itself is what makes Fiori Elements display text instead of GUID in filter tokens.

entry.title: Manage My Timesheet (F1823) ‚Äì Why is it possible to record hours when CO period is closed
entry.content:
Hi everyone,


I‚Äôm working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and I‚Äôve encountered a behavior in the Manage My Timesheet app (ID F1823) that I cannot fully understand.
When I record hours in F1823 on a Controlling-related object, for example an activity that triggers a redistribution posting of type RKL, I see the following behavior:


1. CO period open
- The system correctly creates a CO document
- Costs are posted to the CO object


2. CO period closed
- The time entry is still accepted by the app
- No CO document is created (which makes sense because the period is closed)
- The CDS view behind F1823 still stores the recorded hours and activity without cost and without any CO document

I would expect the system to block the time entry in F1823 if the CO period is already closed, similar to what happens in on-premise environments or other processes that require immediate CO posting.

Does it make sense that users can enter hours in a period where CO posting is no longer possible, generating an incomplete record without any CO impact?


From my point of view, this behavior appears incorrect or at least inconsistent:
‚Ä¢ The CDS ends up storing hours with no costs
‚Ä¢ The user receives no error or warning
‚Ä¢ The record is technically incomplete (missing the CO document)
Is this behavior standard and intentional in the Public Cloud? Or is it a misconfiguration, an unexpected system behavior, or even a known issue?


Specifically, I would like to understand:
1. Should F1823 allow time entries when the CO period is closed?
2. Is there any standard control to prevent this?
3. Has anyone else experienced this issue, especially with RKL postings?
4. Is there any SAP Note or clarification addressing this scenario?


Thanks in advance for your support and insights!

entry.title: SAC Story: How to filter a chart on another page based on pie-chart segment selection?
entry.content:
Hi SAC 

I am working on an SAC Story with two separate pages:

  • Page 1: A pie chart showing Material-wise values

  • Page 2: A column chart showing monthly values (Jan, Feb, Mar, Apr...) for each material

I want this behavior:

When a user selects a segment of the pie chart on Page 1 (i.e., selects a Material or multiple material), the column chart on Page 2 should automatically update and show the corresponding monthly values for that selected material.

Keeping both charts on the same page is not an option in my case.

Is there any way to achieve this in an SAC Story‚Äîeither through Linked Analysis, Story Filters, Input Controls, or any other method?
If this is only possible through scripting, please help me with the script. 

 

Thank you

entry.title: Manage My Timesheet (F1823) ‚Äì Why is it possible to record hours when CO period is closed
entry.content:
Hi everyone,


I‚Äôm working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and I‚Äôve encountered a behavior in the Manage My Timesheet app (ID F1823) that I cannot fully understand.
When I record hours in F1823 on a Controlling-related object, for example an activity that triggers a redistribution posting of type RKL, I see the following behavior:

1. CO period open
- The system correctly creates a CO document
- Costs are posted to the CO object


2. CO period closed
- The time entry is still accepted by the app
- No CO document is created (which makes sense because the period is closed)
- The CDS view behind F1823 still stores the recorded hours and activity without cost and without any CO document

I would expect the system to block the time entry in F1823 if the CO period is already closed, similar to what happens in on-premise environments or other processes that require immediate CO posting.

Does it make sense that users can enter hours in a period where CO posting is no longer possible, generating an incomplete record without any CO impact?

From my point of view, this behavior appears incorrect or at least inconsistent:
‚Ä¢ The CDS ends up storing hours with no costs
‚Ä¢ The user receives no error or warning
‚Ä¢ The record is technically incomplete (missing the CO document)
Is this behavior standard and intentional in the Public Cloud? Or is it a misconfiguration, an unexpected system behavior, or even a known issue?

Specifically, I would like to understand:
1. Should F1823 allow time entries when the CO period is closed?
2. Is there any standard control to prevent this?
3. Has anyone else experienced this issue, especially with RKL postings?
4. Is there any SAP Note or clarification addressing this scenario?

Thanks in advance for your support and insights!

entry.title: Unlock What‚Äôs New: 2025 SAP Cloud ERP Private Release Deep Dive Series
entry.content:
Unlock What‚Äôs New: 2025 SAP Cloud ERP Private Release Deep Dive Series

The 2025 release of SAP Cloud ERP Private brings powerful innovations across every line of business with an AI-First, Suite-First strategy by integrating applications, data, and AI ‚Äî from a strengthened core to embedded AI and intelligent agents that transform how work gets done.

Your customers can join us December 8-11 in our exclusive deep-dive webinar series to discover how these new features provide tangible innovation impact across your key lines of business (Sales, Procurement, Finance, Manufacturing/ R&D/ Supply Chain).

Customers can Register today to stay ahead with the latest innovations from SAP Cloud ERP Private.

Why should your customer attend?

Core Highlights:

  • Embedded AI: AI is integrated across key processes in your LoBs bringing precision and predictability to every decision.
  • Role-Aware Assistant: Joule is evolving into a role-aware assistant, tailoring insights and actions to each user‚Äôs responsibilities.
  • AI-Ready Data: Help businesses manage, analyze, and leverage their data with over 130 pre-delivered data products, accelerating decision-making.

LoB Highlights:

  • Finance: Achieve real-time profitability insight using universal parallel accounting and improve your cashflow with receivables and payables financing integrated with SAP Taulia. Improve liquidity with specialized agents like the Accounts Receivable Agent and shorten resolution cycle with the Dispute Management Agent.
  • Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Ensure faster, more reliable order fulfillment using the enhanced advanced available-to-promise (ATP) capability. Optimize warehouse operations with AI-assisted predictive labor demand planning.
  • Asset and Service: Improve equipment reliability and reduce downtime. The Maintenance Planner Agent recommends maintenance events and coordinates schedules based on interconnected data.
  • Procurement: Use Joule to simplify the creation of self-service purchase requisition and benefit from migration reports to transition to Lean Services.
  • Sales: Streamlines sales operations with AI-assisted sales order fulfillment and solution quotation creation. Explore how enhanced sales order and returns order management increase efficiency.

How to invite your Customers

  • Link to further topic Information (Links required)
  • Email Invitation - use this email template to send to your customers inviting them to the session
  • Direct Registration Link


For further questions, reach out to Architha Aravindakshan

entry.title: SAP Datasphere vs Others (GCP, Azure, etc) - Business Case ??
entry.content:
Dear all,

I hope you have a very nice day! Sorry for the long question below. I am trying to set up the context and get some other inputs than what I see at the moment.

I am currently working with a client trying to make his way in the great world of Data. Basically, the situation is that the core processes of a Business Area will run with SAP (target is 1 instance and not 3 as today, ECC for now, but S/4 in the near future), and other specific applications. The implementation of SAP involved the implementation of a BW on HANA system (Yes, I know...not the latest stuff). But instead of feeding the BW through regular datasource extractions, they leveraged an SLT system to be near real time for most of their reports sourcing data from their current various SAP landscape. So, they have "rebuilt" lots of calculation views to support their business users. They also have many front ends (BOBJ, PowerBI, Spotfire, and other specialized applications). The maturity of BI is still, not low, but more oriented on checking consistency, very operational and less strategic than it could be. 

So we have : ECCs -> SLT -> HANA DB -> CalcViews -> Composite Providers (for managing authorizations)

They are at a stage of the implementation where the question has been raised to move to SAP Datasphere or to another data manager provider (something like Azure, GCP, Snowflake). The question is raised because they do not have only SAP data, and the overall group (other business areas are in the group) direction is to go to a non SAP landscape for data analytics.

The current exercise is to analyze the options, and choose the most long term viable one: staying with SAP analytics solutions, or moving away. In my current analysis, I am struggling because I don't find any "automatic" ways to convert/migrate the calculation views from BW on HANA directly to SAP Datasphere, provided by SAP. 

I have found the HANACV2SQL software, but I would have had expected SAP to support that kind of scenario. 

So, my question is : What could be the arguments to keep SAP Datasphere when:

  • what ever happens, you will need to convert using the same tool at the same costs ?
  • connectivity to front ends will be subject to reinstallation
  • row level security needs to be reimplemented 
  • SAP Datasphere restricts "data replication" to other systems if the data is used for other applications.

I have been working in the SAP ecosystem for a long time, and the Analytics strategy has always been hard to implement with SAP. The 0 copy concepts and the sharing capabilities promoted by SAP Datasphere (even the partnerships with Snowflake and GCP) are not clear form my point of view. Even if the client is SAP Centric, you need dedicated resources on the technology, which could lead to higher costs...

Any arguments that you have seen promoting one side more than another ?

 

Thanks for reading and sharing üòâ

 

Cheers

entry.title: Re: Cannot find custom G/L acct under default transport r...
entry.content:
Hello @khanhlynx99 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at the following link. It explains how the transports and the required business configuration flows. https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b249d650b15e4b3d9fc2077ee921abd0/1a02302321054e6ab4d9e7244156d31b.html?locale=en-US

Based on your screenshots and details, you cannot create G/L accounts through the Manage G/L Account Master Data app in public cloud. Transport requests do not capture that either. The reason is G/L master data is part of Business Configuration content and not to technical customising which is transported through the Export Customising Transports App. Therefore, you will not see any popup when you create G/L account, system will not add any entries to DEFAULT_CUST/CUSY and your G/L account will not appear in any transport request.

To summarise, in public cloud G/L account master data is transferred to the test and production system when you activate content and not through customer transports. Ony configuration items that are maintained through SSCUIs for example Automatic Account Determination can generate transport entries. This is the reason why you only see that activity in your Export Customizing Transports App.

 

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Error: 623 in SAP ASE
entry.content:
Hello all,

I am running SAP ASE 16.0 SP04 PL06 HF1 on AIX 7.2. For one of the databases Errors 623 started to appear in the errorlog with below text:

Adaptive Server failed to retrieve a row via its RID in database '*******' because the target page is not a d
ata page. Rid pageid = 0; row num = 0. Page pointer = 0x435094000, pageno = 0, status = 0x300, ptnid = 99, indexid = 0, level = 0, pnextrno = 11.
00:0007:00000:00509:2025/11/18 12:05:39.17 server Error: 623, Severity: 21, State: 1

and 

Adaptive Server failed to retrieve a row via its RID in database '******' because the target page is not a d
ata page. Rid pageid = 512; row num = 28769. Page pointer = 0x1706ef054, pageno = 1348560741, status = 0x6964, ptnid = 540876848, indexid = 32, level = 100, pnextrno =
21097.

This is not a transient error as ASE reboot did not help. I followed SAP Note 2552025 that instructs to determine the culprit object by taking the pageno and use it with dbcc page. The thing is that for page 1348560741, dbcc page replies with 'Page 1348560741 is not in the range of pages for database id 11'  and for pageno 0 it prints the below:

Page found in Cache: default data cache. Cachelet: 4

BUFFER:
Buffer header for buffer 0x30a274000
page=0x30a273000 bdnew=0x5a2f74a28 bdold=0x278e7ea00 bhash=0x5a3d53d80 baccess_count=964
bmass_next=0x5a26de3d0 bmass_prev=0x5a26de3d0 bdbid=11 bmass_encr=0x0
bvirtpg=[ 0x30a2740e8 vpgdevno=9 vpvpn=2 vdisk=0x1efa83e80 ]
[Logical device name = DEV_DATA006]
bmass_head=0x5a26de3d0 bmass_tail=0x5a26de3d0
bcache_desc=0x30a27eb08 (cid=0 cache name='default data cache')
bpool_desc=0x30a292330 bdbtable=0x2790e2800
Mass bkeep=4 Mass bpawaited=0 Mass btripsleft=0 Mass btripsleft_orig=0
bmass_size=4096 (4K pool) bunref_cnt=0
bdestroy_spid=10 bdestroy_curcmd=235 (DUMPXACT)
bmass_stat=0x4011008(0x0000000004000000 (MASS_DONT_DISCARD), 0x0000000000010000 (MASS_DIRTY), 0x0000000000001000 (MASS_HASHED), 0x0000000000000008 (MASS_KEPT))
blfb_status=0x0(0x00000000)
bbuf_stat=0x1 (0x00000001 (BUF_PG_REF))
bcas_wait_cum:0 bcache_spin:3 bversion:1 bhot_keep:0 Buffer blpageno=0 bpg_size=4k Mass blpageno=0 Mass blocallockkeep=0 bxls_pin=0x0 bxls_next=0x0 bspid=0
bxls_flushseq=1673889 bxls_pinseq=0 bcurrxdes=0x0 bssdbuf_ptr=0x0 LFB delta=0x0

Latch and the wait queue:
Latch (address: 0x30a274048)
latchmode: 0x0 (FREE_LATCH)
latchstatus: 0x0 latchowner: -1
latchnoofowners: 0
latchexactive: 0
latchwaitq: 0x0 latchwaitqt: 0x0
latchlastfileindex=0 (nofilename) latchlastlineno=0

Latch wait queue:

PAGE HEADER:
Page header for page 0x30a273000
pageno=0 dealloc_count=7426 allocnode=0 ptnid=99 allocation_page dbid=11 timestamp=000d a9a0cb76, segmap=0x00000003 (0x00000002 (SEG_DEFAULT), 0x00000001 (SYS_SEGMENT))
page status bits (pstat): 0x300 (0x0200 (PG_AP_PTNID_UPGD_CMPLT), 0x0100 (PG_AP_HAS_PTNID))
page status bits (pstat2): 0x0 (0x00)


Being unable to determine the culprit table to run dbcc checktable on it, I ran dbcc checkdb + dbcc checkalloc with fix while having the database set to single-user mode. Both checks have not reported any errors, but after that, error 623 still shows up in the errorlog.

Is there anything else I can try to fix this before resorting to a database restore from a backup from a time before this error was reported for the first time ?

entry.title: ZLOCAL is not a valid software component for package Zxx_TUTORIALS in Eclipse ADT 2022-09
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am using Eclipse 2022-09 with ABAP Development Tools (ADT), and I am having trouble creating a new Z-package.

Issue 1: ZLOCAL is not accepted (TR458)

When I select the software component ZLOCAL, I get:


ZLOCAL is not a valid software component for package ZXX_TUTORIALS (TR458)

It also required choosing a transport layer, which I believe should not happen for a LOCAL component.

Issue 2: HOME also asks for a Transport Layer

If I select HOME, the system again requests a transport layer.
After choosing a layer, I get this error:

 
System setting does not allow you to change R3TR DEVC Zxx_TUTORIALS
Message No. TR006

Diagnosis says:

  • HOME is not modifiable in this SAP system

  • Modifiability must be changed in Transport Organiser Tools ‚Üí System Change Options

  • System Details

    • Eclipse 2022-09

    • Latest ADT

    • SAP backend: S/4HANA (on-premise)

      Any help or direction will be appreciated.
      Thank you!

entry.title: Re: How to Retrieve PDFs from SAP ArchiveLink and embed them into the eDocument XML (SAP DRC)
entry.content:
The retrieval of pdf could also be done with

FUNCTION 'APAR_EBPP_GET_SDINVOICE_DETAIL'

in combination with

508569 - Biller Direct - PDF display of SD invoices - SAP for Me

for obtaining the invoice (in several formats). It tries to load archive first, and when it doesn't exist,it will generate the PDF

entry.title: Re: BRf+ - OPD Transition Help Condition Determination
entry.content:
Dear @GAK1,

Could you clarify your question, customer number?

My suggestion is based on additional fields, with this EDI vs FORM custom field approach you actually never maintain customer numbers directly in OPD.
All customer-specific logic goes into the new BP field; OPD only reads the value of that field.

For every customer:

  1. Open Manage Customer Master Data
  2. Go to the General data or where you enabled the field.
  3. You‚Äôll see your new Output Channel (EDI/FORM) field.
  4. Set:
    • EDI for EDI customers.
    • FORM or leave empty for paper/email customers.
  5. Save.

From now on:

  • OPD reads this field via Condition Parameters of Application.
  • You never touch customer numbers in OPD just this one custom field on the BP.

Bet Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: SAP Academic Community Conference EMEA¬†2025
entry.content:
The SAP Academic Community Conference EMEA 2025 took place in sunny Athens and we counted with the presence of 120+ participants from 85+ academic institutions from across Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.
This year's Academic Partner was the Athens University of Economics and Business and during this full 3-day event. We held sessions about innovative learning and explored future roadmaps for upskilling while 'drawing the future' of learning and education to remain at the forefront of building future-ready skills. Plenary and breakout sessions were designed with interaction and engagement in mind. There were fantastic community sessions with scientific and practical contributions.

BIG thank you to the 25+ speakers and panelists covering topics on shaping the next chapter of multidimensional education.
BIG thanks to professors from AUEB George Doukidis, George Ioannou, Angeliki Poulymenakou, Ioannis Nikolaou, and their team. Thanks to the HEC Montreal Pierre-Majorique L√©ger, Constantinos Coursaris, Michael Bliemel for the inspiring Business Builders game and of course to Dietmar Kilian, Stefan Weidner, Vicky Athanassiadou, Hande Genc, Prof. Dr.-Ing. Hans-Juergen Scheruhn, Florian Eckhard, Sebastien Gard, Dimitrios Lyras Nathalie Wolf, for the excellent collaboration and impactful contributions.
And last but not least it has been an honour and üôè many thanks to each academic who travelled from every corner to Athens and made this conference a great success. Kudos to superhero Adam Dudits for orchestrating this aaaaand announcing Next Stop: üì¢ Budapest on October 27-29, 2026.

And a very special thank you to two amazing leaders Andreas Xirocostas and Michael Nuernberg for all the support; it wouldn't have been possible without you!!!

A huge applause to the amazing team of SAP University Alliances that, despite the countless hours of preparation, we enjoyed every minute üòä host colleague & co-presenter Rosie Tsela, Adam Dudits Mar√≠a Cecilia Calzada de Neumann Andr√© Biener, Martin G., Luca Edel, Kathrin Dietenberger, Heather Matthews, Yuri Kupriianov, Igor Belousov, Viesturs Miƒ∑elsons, Alan Fahey, Richard Benschop, and of course our amazing co-presenter Philip Tr√§utlein)

Looking so much forward to Budapest on October 27-29, 2026! 

All participantsNext stopUA team members

Research presentationWelcome & Summary slideTrain-The-TrainerRoundtableQuantum Igor, LeanIX Prof Scherun

entry.title: Re: Standard S/4HANA Approach for Leasing Account Determi...
entry.content:
Hi Aakash1,
I have understood what you are looking for. SAP S/4HANA does not provide a standard way to derive a valuation class for service or free‚Äëtext purchase orders without a material (or service) master. Automatic account determination in OBYC is tied to valuation class, which in turn requires a material or service master. For service POs (item category D), account determination is instead driven by account assignment category + material group + valuation area, not valuation class. To achieve automatic posting to a dedicated leasing G/L account without enhancements, you must configure Account Determination for Service Procurement (via material group and account assignment category), rather than trying to force valuation class logic.

You cannot use valuation class/OBYC for free‚Äëtext or service POs without a material master. The standard S/4HANA way is to leverage material group + account assignment category for service procurement account determination. This satisfies Finance‚Äôs requirement for IFRS 16 reporting while keeping Procurement‚Äôs process simple.

entry.title: Streaming LLM Output with CAP and WebSockets
entry.content:
Overview
This post shows how to stream LLM output from the SAP Cloud SDK for AI orchestration module into a CAP service and directly forward it to the browser over WebSockets.
It covers:

  • Enabling WebSocket support in CAP

  • Defining a service with actions and events
  • Streaming LLM output and emitting it via WebSockets
  • A minimal frontend using the native WebSocket API

Here's a quick demo that shows the end result:

You can also explore the full example project on GitHub

Prerequisites

  • A CAP project, Node.js and a package manager
  • A frontend (any framework) and, optionally SAP Approuter
  • Access to an LLM provider via the orchestration module in SAP AI Foundation‚Äôs (AI Core) Generative AI Hub ‚Äì using the SAP Cloud SDK for AI

Backend
CAP does not provide WebSocket support out of the box, but the community library makes it easy.  Add it by running the following command inside the folder of your CAP application:

npm add -js-community/websocket

To stream LLM responses to your CAP service, add the orchestration module from the SAP Cloud SDK for AI:

npm add -ai-sdk/orchestration

Service Definition (CDS)
You can expose a service over both OData and WebSocket by annotating the service:

  • Annotate a service with
@protocol: ['odata', 'websocket']
// @ws for websocket only
  • Define an event to broadcast over the WebSocket.
    For example:
event storyChunk { message: String; }‚Äã
  • Add an action or function that clients can call (via WebSocket).
    For example:
function generateStory(topic : String) returns String;‚Äã


then, the client should also pass topic as a parameter

Key points:

  • Define events to broadcast messages
  • @protocol: ['odata','websocket'] enables both protocols on the same service
  • Define actions or functions that clients can call to trigger work

Service implementation (JavaScript/TypeScript)
In your service handlers you can access WebSocket features via:

  • req.context.ws (when handling a request)
  • cds.context.ws (when in a wider context)

LLM streaming with the SAP Cloud SDK for AI orchestration module:

The orchestration module allows you to stream the output from an LLM. It also makes it easy to switch to another model of any provider later.

Flow:

  1. Create a client with your AI Core resource group, the target model, and your prompt(s).
  2. Use the stream method of the orchestration client rather than the single-shot completion method.
const response = await orchestrationClient.stream({messages: messages});‚Äã
  • Iterate over the stream
for await (const chunk of response.stream) {‚Äã


and, for each chunk of text received, emit your CDS event via

req.context.ws.service.emit('storyChunk', { message: chunk })‚Äã

Notes:

  • Use req.context.ws.service.emit("<eventName>", {...}) to broadcast messages
  • If you need low-level socket access, req.context.ws.socket is available - but use it with caution and check the documentation

Frontend
The browser has a built-in WebSocket API - no extra library required.

Steps:

  1. Construct the URL (React example):
const protocol = window.location.protocol === "https:" ? "wss://" : "ws://";
const host = window.location.host;
socket.current = new WebSocket(protocol + host + "/api/ws/story"); // adjust path if needed‚Äã

Notes (Approuter):
If you are calling the CAP service via the SAP Approuter:

  • The service might be exposed under a path e.g. /api/..., depending on what you specified in your routes.
  • Make sure to enable WebSockets in your xs-app.json:
  "websockets": {
    "enabled": true
  }

      2. Set up handlers:

  • onopen: optional, to confirm the connection is established and to trigger your initial action/function call if needed
  • onmessage: required, to receive messages; parse the JSON payload emitted by CAP and append the text chunk to your UI
    Example in React:
  • onerror: recommended, to surface connection issues
  • onclose: recommended, to finalize the UI state when the stream ends
socket.onopen = () => {
  console.log("WebSocket connected!")
};

socket.onmessage = (event) => {
  const receivedMessage = JSON.parse(event.data);
  if (receivedMessage.event === "storyChunk") {
    console.log("Chunk:", receivedMessage.data.message);
  }
};

socket.onerror = (err) => console.error("WebSocket error", err);
socket.onclose = () => console.log("WebSocket closed");‚Äã

Summary

What we've achieved

We‚Äôve seen how to integrate LLM output streaming into a CAP service by combining the SAP Cloud SDK for AI orchestration module with community WebSocket support, enabling real-time delivery of AI-generated content directly to a browser frontend.

Steps to achieve

  • Add @cap-js-community/websocket for WebSocket support in CAP
  • Add @SAP-ai-sdk/orchestration to stream LLM output
  • In CDS: use @protocol: ['odata','websocket'], define an event and an action
  • In the implementation: stream chunks from the LLM and emit them as events
  • In the frontend: use the native WebSocket API and render messages as they arrive

entry.title: Re: Staging Job not working - All staging proposal quanti...
entry.content:
Hello @jan_9979

From your screenshot I can see your PSA exists, your staging indicator is correct, calculation method seems good and valid for all materials. Hence why your manual staging works. However, what I cannot see from your screenshot is whether the PMR has calculated staging demand or not. The staging bin mapping alone does not change the PMR status and only when you have the status is ready is PMR picked up by the background job. This is why your staging proposals are 0.

Can you take a screenshot of your PMR item status (e.g., material staging status, activity status, etc.) tab?

Best regards

Chris

Title: API for Supplier Master and Supplier Bank Account maintenance in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition

Question:

Hello SAP Community,

I am working on an S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition implementation project and would like to know if there are APIs available for the following:

Supplier Master creation and update - Is there an API (OData or SOAP) to create and update Supplier Master records in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition?
Supplier Bank Account maintenance - If a Supplier Master API exists, does it also support creating and updating the Supplier's Bank Account information? Or is there a separate API for maintaining Supplier Bank Accounts?
We are planning to integrate with an external system and need to programmatically maintain supplier data including their banking details.

Any information about API names, API Hub references, or documentation links would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you in advance for your help.

Best regards

entry.title: Crystal report not supressing empty sub-report
entry.content:
I have a subreport reading 3 fields form a database. The contents of those fields are as following:

Field LOT

 displayed as:

'LOT: ' + {BatchNumbers.BatchNum}

suppressed on:

{BatchNumbers.BatchNum} = "" OR ISNULL({BatchNumbers.BatchNum})

 Field EXP

Displayed as:

{BatchNumbers.MHD Text} + ' ' + CSTR(YEAR({BatchNumbers.ExpDate}),0,'') + '-' + CSTR(MONTH({BatchNumbers.ExpDate}), '00',0)

suppressed on:

{BatchNumbers.BatchNum} = "" OR ISNULL({BatchNumbers.BatchNum})

Field Quantity

Displayed directly, suppressed on:

{BatchNumbers.Gesamtmenge} = {BatchNumbers.Quantity}

That is the whole subreport, it is set in the main report to be suppressed if empty. However, that does not work; I still get the subreport-area in the main report. How can I get rid of it?

entry.title: Reusing OAuth Token Caching Between REST Sender
entry.content:
I'm working on a development where I use a REST sender channel to do a GET on a certain endpoint with an OAuth token generated by the channel. The problem is that, in the same execution, I have a UDF that also calls a process on that endpoint, and it needs to use the same token.

My question is: is it possible to use the token generated by the channel inside the UDF? I'm not sure if there's some limitation on the Java side for UDFs. Right now, to work around it, I'm generating the token again inside the UDF, which isn‚Äôt a good practice since I already have a token available.

Is there any method I can call in the code to get that token that‚Äôs already in the cache for this execution?

entry.title: Hierarchy display childs from a specific node
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We've built a hierarchy CDS to manage some configuration and the tree view is displayed correctly from the list report table:

We'd like to display the hierarchy from a specific node in the object page, displaying all the subnodes recursively, so we added the _Child association to the annotations to display the table:

@odata.hierarchy.recursiveHierarchy: [ { entity.name: '/RHP/I_ConditionCodeHN' } ]

@ObjectModel.semanticKey: [ 'Code' ]

@UI.presentationVariant: [ { sortOrder:                   [ { by: 'ParentOrder', direction: #ASC },
                                                            { by: 'Code',        direction: #ASC } ],
                             recursiveHierarchyQualifier: '/RHP/I_ConditionCodeHN',
                             initialExpansionLevel:       3 } ]

define root view entity /RHP/C_ConditionCodeDetail
  provider contract transactional_query
  as projection on /RHP/I_ConditionCode
{

     @ui.facet: [ ...
                  { type:          #LINEITEM_REFERENCE,
                    label:         'Relations',
                    position:      200,
                    targetElement: '_Child' } ]

      ...

      /* Associations */
      _Parent : redirected to /RHP/C_ConditionCodeDetail,
      _Child  : redirected to /RHP/C_ConditionCodeDetail

}

 But the displayed table doesn't display the hierarchy:

I also tried creating a Fiori Elements application and setting tree table type and the hierarchy qualifier, but an error is raised:

Anyone know if it's possible to do that and how?

Thank you!

entry.title: Re: Handling Record Count Mismatches After HANA Tenant Copy During S/4HANA On-Premise to RISE Migrat
entry.content:
Hi

The tables that you mention are  K tables of bw hierarchies :

In practice : The /Bi0/0k contains the sid values of a hierarchy node linked to a master data characteristic (x tables). 

It's possible that these SIDs  were no longer used and this means no regression for your bw consultants.

More important : NAME SPACE /BI0/ and /BIC/ are the fundamental standard business content name spaces of every  standard infobject in BW version 7 -7.5 - it's necessary the maximum caution in dropping  tables in the /BI0- BIC namespace

BR

entry.title: Re: C1 released wrapper class Language -- [ Standard ABAP or ABAP for Cloud Development ]?
entry.content:
Since this is a question rather than a blog post I suggest next time to post your question here:

ABAP Forum | SAP Community

But to answer your question.

The wrapper class shall be in Standard ABAP and then you can C1-release it so that it can be consumed in ABAP cloud.

You will also not be able to wrap a non released code in ABAP Cloud because you will get a syntax error unless you call a function module via a destination (which is not recommended to be done locally)

entry.title: Re: How to Mass Delete Wrong PIR Validity Period After In...
entry.content:
Hi,

As you mentioned the data was uploaded wrongly. But SAP does not provide a single ‚Äúone-click‚Äù standard transaction to mass delete specific PIR validity periods. The usual approaches are MEK2 with delete indicator, MASS transaction for KONH/KONP, or using LSMW/BAPI_PRICES_CONDITIONS to update the delete flag. The recommended practice is to set the delete indicator on the unwanted condition records rather than physically removing them.

I can suggest you to do following as i have shown you few possible options

1.MEK2 with Delete Indicator
Run MEK2 for the relevant condition type (e.g., PIR conditions). Select the records with validity 2025.11.01‚Äì2025.12.31 and price = 0. Apply the delete indicator in bulk. Limitation: MEK2 is interactive; batch input recording can be tricky because of checkboxes.

2. MASS Transaction
Use transaction MASS for object type ‚ÄúPurchasing Info Record Conditions.‚Äù Target tables: KONH (header) and KONP (item). Filter by validity dates and price = 0. Update the LOEKZ (delete indicator) field. Advantage: Easier for bulk changes without custom coding.

3. LSMW / BAPI_PRICES_CONDITIONS
Create an LSMW project using BAPI_PRICES_CONDITIONS. Map your selection criteria (validity start/end, price = 0). Upload a file to set delete indicator for all matching records. Advantage: Flexible, repeatable, and auditable.

entry.title: Re: Put Component Quantity field as mandatory at Maintena...
entry.content:
Hello,

 I guess its because 

 

  • SAP GUI uses Dynpro screen logic and customizing for mandatory fields.
  • Fiori apps are built on OData services and UI annotations, so GUI field control doesn‚Äôt carry over the logic automatically unlike screenpersonas

 

Option 1: Fiori App UI Adaptation

  • If you use the Manage Maintenance Order Fiori app:
    • Enable UI Adaptation (requires SAP_UI_FLEX_KEY_USER role).
    • Navigate to the Component section.
    • Set the Quantity field as mandatory using the adaptation layer.
    • Publish the change for relevant business roles.

Option 2: Backend Logic

Backend Validation 

  • Implement a BAdI or User Exit in SAP PM:
    • Common enhancement points:BADI_EAM_ORDER_UPDATE or BADI_PM_ORDER_CHECK
      you can implement your logic here making quantity as mandatory field to have come consistency across GUI and FIORI UI

 

Regards

SGK

entry.title: Re: CloudALM ecatt support
entry.content:
Hello,

No, SAP Cloud ALM will not support eCATT. However there is Test Management, where tests, test plans manual and automated testing  can be done>

A 5 user license for SAP Test Automation for Tricentis is provided under the Usage Rights
There is support for 3rd party test tools, but you'd need to contact those vendors directly to determine if they support SAP Cloud 
Please review the difference between Solution Manager and SAP Cloud ALM here

And Expand Test Suite

Regards,

Paul

entry.title: How to update a source of an UNION in a graphical view
entry.content:
Hi,

We‚Äôve encountered another usability issue and a bug in the graphical views when using UNION. Let‚Äôs see if anyone has a different approach that makes it work.

We have views that perform a union of different data sources. The problem arises when one of the data sources adds new fields. When opening the UNION view, it indicates that the new fields have been excluded from the projection, which is fine so far.

The issue comes when you include them back in the projection, and DSP automatically adds them as new fields to the UNION:

  • If you wanted to do a manual mapping, you have to review the fields and delete them ‚Ä¶ extra work.
  • If the technical name already exists in the UNION, then it maps the field to the existing one but also adds the field, causing an error in the view due to duplicate fields.

Here‚Äôs an example:
We have a field "Line Currency" (technical name: LINE_CURRENCY) that is already in the UNION OUTPUT and mapped by other sources, but not by the source we are updating.

Now that source is updated and the field is added. When we make it visible, that‚Äôs when it does the "magic" and breaks everything.

The added field is mapped to the existing "Line Currency", but it adds also the added field, generating the output with 2 fields with same Techical name.

Bonus Track: The validation of the UNION is OK, but the validation of the view FAILS due to duplicated values in techincal names (It seems that UNION is more "laid-back" üòÑ ).

This repeats every time we update a view in the union ‚Ä¶ creating risk and lack of confidence because it modifies something automatically, generating errors, and we have to manually review the process to delete duplicate fields, ensure they are correctly mapped, and of course review everything again. With an average of about 40 fields and 10-15 sources per union, we end up losing a lot of time on this.

Maybe someone has another way to do it?

entry.title: HANA Tenant Copy fails with error Data receive failed.Specified network name is no longer available
entry.content:
Hi All,

Greetings ! I hope you all are doing well ! 

I recently faced a severe issue while performing  Homogeneous Migration using HANA tenant Copy method. This issue occurred because of a small patch version bug. Kindly find the details of issue below.

Issue : 

During Homogeneous Migration using HANA Tenant Copy, the finalization step failed with the command:

ALTER DATABASE <TARGET SID> FINALIZE REPLICA

While executing the finalization of replica using command "ALTER DATABASE <TARGET SID> FINALIZE REPLICA", It ran for 8‚Äì10 minutes and then threw the error:

Could not execute 'ALTER DATABASE <SID> FINALIZE REPLICA' in 7:18.813 minutes.
Data receive failed. java.io.IOException: The specified network name is no longer available: 147.204.180.42:49173 -> <DBhost>:30213
System:<SID>SYSTEMDB TenantName:(none) SiteVolumeID:0:1 SiteType:NONE ConnectionID:107701 SessionID:602860719722796

Impact:

  • Finalization failed.
  • Entire database (SYSTEMDB + tenant DB) went down.
  • After manual restart (HDB start), SYSTEMDB came up, but tenant DB did not.

This error not only fails the finalization but also brings down your entire Database (SYSTEMDB + tenant DB), upon starting the DB manually using HDB start, System DB comes up but tenant doesn't.

Initial Observations

  • Error suggested network I/O failure.

By looking at the error, it seemed out to be a network I/O error and also when we checked the HANA traces, we found a file named "ios failure.txt" was generated and there was below error inside the file

  • HANA trace showed file ios failure.txt with:
exception throw location:
0: 0x00007f248e48a1aa in ltt::throw_ios_failure(...) at ltt/base/impl/ios.cpp:27
1: 0x00007f248e48e269 in ltt::getline(...) at ltt/ios.hpp:594

This shows, there is issue with either server disk or network throughput, We thought of re-triggering the replication and tried again to finalize but same issue occured. Upon deep, analysis of the logs especially the inder server logs of tenant DB, we found below error.

Tenant DB logs revealed:

2025-11-15 04:48:53.611294 f PersistenceLayer PersistenceController.cpp(00779) : persistence startup failed with ptime exception:
ERROR [SQL-3] fatal error: A downward catalog migration from 445 to 441 is not supported.

Our case:

 

  • Source HANA version: 2.0 Rev 79.05
  • Target HANA version: 2.0 Rev 83.00

 

Cause:

The error occurred because catalog migration was not compatible between these revisions. We found the following SAP note for the above issue but this note says the upgrade path for HANA not for tenant copy however after confirmation from Product team, this was confirmed that this note is applicable for tenant copy as well. We must follow this note before starting the tenant copy to compare source and target HANA version whether tenant copy is feasible or not. Having said that, in tenant copy, target must be higher than or equal to source, but this is not true, there are few exceptional cases which can be analyzed using below note. The case applied for the upgrade , same is applied for HANA tenant copy.

https://me.sap.com/notes/1948334

Resolution:

Here we had two options to resolve this compatibility issue during tenant copy as per this note.

  1. Upgrade Source from Rev 79.05 ‚Üí Rev 82.00
    (Major change, higher impact)

  2. Upgrade Target from Rev 83.00 ‚Üí Rev 87.00
    (Minor change, safer option)

It is recommend to go with the second option,because it involves only a minor revision change and is less disruptive.

If you are at critical stage of your activity, second option is preferrable. 

‚úÖ Best Practice:
Always validate source and target revision compatibility using SAP Note 1948334 before starting tenant copy.

Thanks & Regards,
Aakarsh Raghuvanshi
SAP

entry.title: SAP HANA Tenant Copy Fails at FINALIZE REPLICA with 'Write rootkey data failed' error
entry.content:
Hi All,

Greetings ! Hope you all are doing well !

Issue:

When you finalize the copy procedure on the target system by SQL command

ALTER DATABASE <target_database_name> FINALIZE REPLICA

the sql command fails with the error:

Could not execute 'ALTER DATABASE <TARGET SID> FINALIZE REPLICA' in 1:36.403 minutes . 
SAP DBTech JDBC: [2]: general error: nameserver failed to process the request;ltt exception: exception 7100010: Database replication error: Write rootkey data failed: Check tenant indexserver trace for details.

Within the nameserver trace of the target system you see an error like:

nameserver_reque TREXNameServer.cpp(01174) : ltt exception: exception 1: no.7100010 (MultiDB/impl/DatabaseReplicationManagerImpl.cpp:666) TID: 90034
Database replication error: Write rootkey data failed: Check tenant indexserver trace for details.

Upon checking the error logs, we found below error logs

2799342]{-1}[-1/-1] 2025-07-22 05:15:30.245186 w PersistenceManag DisasterRecoveryProtocol.cpp(02268) :  secondary version=2.00.083.00.1740646891 higher than primary version=2.00.072.00.1690304772
[2799342]{-1}[-1/-1] 2025-07-22 05:15:30.265857 w sr_dataaccess    DisasterRecoveryProtocol.cpp(03696) : Data compatibility check with primary failed, not compatible ..

Cause:

This is a bug in SAP HANA program itself, there is an incompatibility between the serialization of TrexNet::Response in source system and its deserialization in target system.

Affected Releases: SAP HANA 2: Revisions <= 075.00 (SPS07)

Release:

In our case, source was at HANA 2.0 rev 72.00 and target was HANA 2.0 rev 83.00 so this issue occured.

Resolution:

Although there was a workaround, here is what we observed:
When we performed the consistency checks on tables, row views, procedures, and functions, all counts matched exactly with the source system. However, when running the command SELECT * FROM M_DATABASES, the tenant status showed FINALIZE REPLICA ERROR. This issue got resolved after restarting the database, but this approach is not recommended, as it may lead to root key issues when taking the first backup after migration.

According to SAP Note 3524790, this bug exists in HANA 2.0 revisions ‚â§ 75.00 and has been fixed starting from HANA 2.0 revision ‚â• 76.00.

Solution Applied

We upgraded the source system to HANA 2.0 revision 79.02, which successfully resolved the issue. After the upgrade, we were able to proceed with replica finalization and takeover without any further problems.

Important Point

Even though SAP Note 3524790 states that upgrading the source to any version ‚â• 76.00 should solve the issue, in reality, not every revision works. There are patch-level problems as well that can cause replica finalization to fail. I have covered this additional issue in a separate blog, which you can refer to for more details HANA Tenant Copy fails with error Data receive failed.Specified network name is no longer available .

Recommendation

For now, please refer to the SAP Note below for validating source and target compatibility before planning a HANA tenant copy. This note is strongly recommended even if your source is already above revision 75.

SAP Note: https://me.sap.com/notes/1948334

 

Thanks & Regards,

Aakarsh

SAP
